senses.sense_definition: Describing a time period, such as a day or month, inserted into a calendar to make it align with the solar year.

examples.text: The <w>intercalary</w> day in February ensures that our calendar remains synchronized with the seasons.
Many ancient civilizations used an <w>intercalary</w> month to correct the drift caused by lunar cycles.

senses.sense_definition: Inserted or situated between other distinct parts, layers, or elements.

examples.text: In some plants, <w>intercalary</w> growth allows the stem to elongate from the base of the nodes.
The biologist examined the <w>intercalary</w> structures located between the major veins of the insect wing.

senses.sense_definition: A day, month, or other period inserted into a calendar.

examples.text: February 29th is the most familiar <w>intercalary</w> in the modern Gregorian calendar.
Historians debate how the ancient priests determined when to add the <w>intercalary</w>.
